revised_title: Researches on Turacin: An Animal Pigment Containing Copper
tldr: The author investigates the presence of turacin, an animal pigment containing copper, in various bird species. Turacin is found in 18 out of 25 species of the Musophagidae family, with the remaining seven species lacking this pigment. The author also discusses the chemical and physical differences between turacin and haemocyanin, another copper-containing pigment found in some animals.
